item.title: Interplanetary File System (IPFS)
item.description: Interplanetary File System (IPFS)The Interplanetary File System (IPFS) is a distributed file storage protocol that allows computers all over the globe to store and serve files as part of a giant peer-to-peer network. Any computer, anywhere in the world, can download the IPFS software and start hosting and serving files. If someone runs IPFS on their computer and uploads a file to the IPFS network, that file can be viewed and downloaded by anyone else in the world who is also running IPFS.

item.title: DNSLink gateways
item.description: DNSLink gatewaysWhen you set up a gateway with a DNSLink record, that gateway is restricted to a particular piece of content (either a specific Content Identifier (CID) or an Interplanetary Name Service (IPNS) hostname). A gateway with a DNSLink - otherwise known as a restricted gateway - differs from a universal gateway, which allows users to access any content hosted on the IPFS network. ​​ What is it? When you import anything to the IPFS, that item gets a unique content identifier ( CID External link icon Open external link ) similar to bafybeiaysi4s6lnjev27ln5icwm6tueaw2vdykrtjkwiphwekaywqhcjze.

item.title: Universal Path gateway
item.description: Universal Path gatewayWhen you set up a Universal Path gateway — a gateway without a DNSLink record — you are creating an unrestricted gateway that allows users to access any content hosted on the IPFS network. This differs from a restricted gateway, which restricts the gateway to a particular piece of content (either a specific Content Identifier (CID) or an Interplanetary Name Service (IPNS) hostname). ​​ How is it used with Cloudflare?
